newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares rally on electric, retail demand.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares rally on electric, retail demand.

text.p: Bullish Chilean stocks roared higher to their highest levels since 1994 on strong demand for electrical and retail stocks.

The blue-chip IPSA index ended the first round of trade at 11:30 a.m. (1530 GMT) up 1.4 percent to 125.43 points, and the all-share IGPA index was up 0.77 percent to 5489.07 points in feverish trade on the Santiago Stock Exchange.
Electrical shares powered higher on a buy recommendation from ING Barings for Endesa, which was up 2.2 percent to 277.50 pesos, and Almendros rose 2.7 percent to 154 pesos.
Supermarket chain Santa Isabel was up 2.1 percent 725 pesos, and Telex-Chile was up 2.3 percent to 1085 pesos.
